qas.question: After the fall of Napoleon, many countries retained what system of law?
Outside Europe, Napoleonic Code has been used as the basis for certain parts of what?
How can the memory of Napoleon in Poland be characterized as?
Poland views Napoleon in a positive light partially based on his opposition to what country?
One reason Poland views Napoleon favorably is due to his abolition of what form of indentured servitude?

context: After the fall of Napoleon, not only was <a0_0>Napoleonic Code<a0_0/> retained by conquered countries including the Netherlands, Belgium, parts of Italy and Germany, but has been used as the basis of certain parts of <a1_0>law<a1_0/> outside Europe including the Dominican Republic, the US state of Louisiana and the Canadian province of Quebec. The memory of Napoleon in Poland is <a2_0>favorable<a2_0/>, for his support for independence and opposition to <a3_0>Russia<a3_0/>, his legal code, the abolition of <a4_0>serfdom<a4_0/>, and the introduction of modern middle class bureaucracies.
